titlestmt.titleproper: Asian Cultural Council records, Indo-US Subcommission on Education and Culture, RG 3
A Guide to the Asian Cultural Council records, Indo-US Subcommission on Education and Culture, RG 3 FA1401

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-02-17 11:01:33 -0500.

did.unittitle: Asian Cultural Council records, Indo-US Subcommission on Education and Culture, RG 3

physdesc.extent: 38 document boxes, 1 half-document box and 1 standard record storage box.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Record Group 2 is arranged in five series:

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Asian Cultural Council is a publicly supported not for profit 501(c)(3) established in 1980 to support cultural exchange between Asia and the United States. The Council carries forward the mission of the Asian Cultural Program of the JDR 3rd Fund, which had been created by JDR 3rd in 1963 and was officially dissolved in July 1979.

The Asian Cultural Council maintains offices in New York, Hong Kong, Manila (Philippines), Taipei (Taiwan) and Tokyo. ACC affiliation with the Rockefeller Brothers Fund began in 1991, enabling the Council to reduce administrative overhead and devote a larger percentage of its funds directly to grants and program development.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Asian Cultural Council records were donated to the RAC in 2010.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: RAC has legal title, copyright and literary rights to the collection in so far as it holds them.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records primarily include corrrespondence, meeting records funding files, select grants, as well documentation for and planning of the Festival of India. Festival of India files can also be found in RG 2 (FA1400).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Records documenting the activities of the Indo‐U.S. Sub‐Commission on Education and Culture are contained in several archival collections at RAC including the Asian Cultural Council, the JDR 3rd Fund and the Asia Society. The Sub‐Commission officially closed its office in July 1996.

did.unittitle: Aadmi Aur Aurat (English title: Man and Woman), India - Window on World Television

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hindi language Telefilm directed by Tapan Sinha and starring Amol Palekar, Mahua Roy Chawdhary. The movie was telecast on Doordarshan, Government owned TV Channel of India.
Plot: A man and a woman travel through a jungle. When the man learns about the woman's pregnancy, he decides to accompany her on her journey and helps her overcome all the hurdles.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.
